message: Finally made the jump to Python
Formerly i develop with PHP or Java
Django fucking rocks
Million times better than the best PHP frameworks (Codeigniter, IMO)
Just want to say I'm glad that I chose Django as my first python framework
@shacker My thought exactly
After a while you wondered how you ever survived on anything else.
welcome to our planet. ;)
Feels good man. Feels good.
PHP makes me shudder
Django makes me feel warm and fuzzy. Wait. The fuzzy part might be whisky (or not)!
3 years later - fuzzy feeling still there.
@mkelley33 don't you mean wsgi ?
@ptone LOL yes! pun intended ;) wait: I mean whisky *and* wsgi!! seriously.
Oh, you just remind me.. After 2+ years working with Django only, I need to work on a PHP project. It feels like a ninja kick in my balls :(
@Leech Good luck on that one. And don't forget the ;'s
@JerkMan and the $! And I mean the literal symbol, not the monetary revenue :S

@izadcmuda I agree but I can't wait until python and django are supported on more servers. If it was more accessible and easier for hosting companies to setup and install then more people could experience the greatness that is python and django. I guess that's why so many people still use php, it's easier for hosting companies to install and setup so it becomes more accessible.
I agree, Django does rock. I've recently started using it but it and python are awesome. The only thing is I wish there were more video tutorials, like the one's I've seen for ROR

@garthhumphreys I agree. Right now I still find it difficult to pitch Django successfully to companies that have an existing infrastructure if they are not already using it. Almost everyone has a LAMP stack somewhere, but try explaining to a client that you need their IT department to install mod_wsgi, pip, virtualenv (and _maybe_ an alt-install of Python if their distro is old enough)... which is a crying shame, because Django _does_ rock.
Im on CodeIgniter too and the final words are like yours: Django rocks!!
